bhaggava：bhaggava（pu）
ဘဂ္ဂဝ（ပု）
[bhaggu+ṇava．bhaggano a paccaṃ bhaggavo．rū．371．thī-nitea bhaggavī．]
[ဘဂ္ဂု+ဏဝ။ ဘဂ္ဂနော အ ပစ္စံ ဘဂ္ဂဝေါ။ ရူ။ ၃၇၁။ ထီ-၌ ဘဂ္ဂဝီ။]

Bhaggava，[cp．Sk．*bhārgava，a der．fr．bhṛgu，& bhargaḥ，of same root as Lat．fulgur lightning; Gr．flόc light; Ger．blitzen，blank; Ags．blanca white horse，all of the idea of “shining，bright，radiant．＂ -- How the meaning “potter＂ is connected with this meaning，is still a problem，perhaps we have to take the word merely as an Epithet at the one passage where it occurs，which happens to be in the Kumbhakāra-jātaka，v．6，7．i．e．the “Jātaka of the potter＂] potter （？） J．III，381，382，in Voc．bhaggava （m．） & bhaggavī （f．）．The terms are not expl<sup>d</sup> in C．，evidently because somewhat obscure．According to Kern，Toev．s．v．the Sk．form in this meaning occurs at MBh．I．190，47; Saddhp．191 sq．，MVastu III，347．（Page 496）

bhaggava：ဘဂ္ဂဝ（ပု）
[ဘဂ္ဂု+ဏဝ။ ဘဂ္ဂနော အ ပစ္စံ ဘဂ္ဂဝေါ။ ရူ။ ၃၇၁။ ထီ-၌ ဘဂ္ဂဝီ။]
ဘဂ္ဂဝ-အိုးထိန်း-သည်။

bhaggava：ဘဂ္ဂဝ （ပ）
အိုးထိန်းသည်။

bhaggava：ဘဂ္ဂဝ （တိ） （ဘဂု+ဏ）
ဘဂုအနွယ်ဖြစ်သော။
